arm_group.description: Surgery after warm-up task Preoperative Warm-Up training

brief_summary.textblock:
Background and Objectives: All modern surgical procedures require a high level of cognitive
      and psychomotor skills achieved using different training methods, but could be influenced by
      fatigue and other psychological factors. We evaluate the effect of warm-up exercises on
      operative laparoscopic performances in gynecologic laparoscopic procedures.

      Methods: The surgical team operates on a consecutive series of 20 patients and perform
      laparoscopic salpingo-oophorectomy. Patients are randomly allocated in 2 groups: group A to
      be operated on without warm-up exercises and group B to be operated on after a short-term
      warm-up. All patients are operated on by the same surgical team. The full-time records of
      the operation were analyzed by 2 independent reviewers.  Laparoscopic procedures are
      recorded and assessed by 2 independent observers using the generic OSATS rating scale. A
      training module using the Lap Sim simulator was designed for the warm-up.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  residents or faculty at the Dept. of Gynecology and Obstetrics

          -  completed skills training

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  none

link.description: Surgical Skills Training Center, Medical University of Vienna

facility.name: Dept. Gynecology and Obstetrics, Medical University of Vienna, Austria

clinical_study.official_title: Preoperative Warm-up in Gynecologic Surgery Using a Virtual Reality Simulator.

primary_outcome.description: Surgical Performance will be assessed using Objective structured assessment of technical skills (OSATS)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
